itemLabel: Leonard Courtney, 1st Baron Courtney of Penwith

wikipedia_page.main: Leonard Henry Courtney, 1st Baron Courtney of Penwith  (6 July 1832 – 11 May 1918) was a radical British politician, and an academic, who became famous after being advocate of proportional representation in Parliament and acting as an opponent of imperialism and militarism.He was a member of William Ewart Gladstone's second administration from 1880 to 1883 and served as Chairman of Ways and Means (Deputy Speaker of the House of Commons) between 1886 and 1893. He was the first and the last Baron Courtney of Penwith.
